channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: 'Wrecking-ball politics': A guide to what's at stake at the 62nd Munich Security Conference 2026
Bangladesh says yes to national referendum on constitutional reforms. What changes?
BNP returns to power after 20 years, Gen-Z on losing side… Bangladesh election results explained
How ‘dark prince’ Tarique Rahman became frontrunner for Bangladesh PM’s post
FirstUp: Bangladesh election results likely, Munich Security Conference starts... Today's headlines
How Indian duo was kidnapped and held hostage in Azerbaijan on their way to the US
Epstein’s death homicide or suicide? Latest DoJ files deepen mystery
item.description: Newly released interviews of an inmate and two guards present during Jeffrey Epstein’s death and the differences in the DoJ and FBI analyses of footage raise serious questions

item.title: Bangladesh polls: Why India should watch Jamaat’s resurgence closely
item.description: Jamaat’s return to the centre of electoral politics signals a new and potentially volatile chapter in the country’s political development — one whose implications will be felt well beyond Bangladesh

item.title: Journalism’s business model is broken: Lessons from Washington Post layoffs
item.description: Journalism has survived many crises, but today’s challenge is different because it is built into the economics of the industry itself

item.title: From Berbera to Bab el-Mandeb: Enter the New Great Game in the Horn of Africa
item.description: As Somaliland enters the diplomatic spotlight, the Horn of Africa is fast becoming the epicentre of a new great-power contest over the Red Sea and global trade routes

item.title: How Jamaat breaks free of BNP’s shadow to emerge as a power centre in Bangladesh polls
item.description: The Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami leads an 11-party alliance, formalised in late 2025, bringing together traditional Islamist forces like Bangladesh Khelafat Majlis and Nezame-e-Islam, as well as an apparently secular force in the form of the National Citizen Party

item.title: How great empires rise and fall: A cue to America’s fate
item.description: Like Ottoman, Mughal, Qing and British, America’s decline will be gradual
